00033 void init_board( int wanted_board_size )
00034 {
00035     int i, j;
00036 
00037     board_size = wanted_board_size;
00038 
00039     board = malloc( board_size * sizeof(int *) );
00040     hoshi = malloc( board_size * sizeof(bool *) );
00041     if ( board == NULL || hoshi == NULL ) {
00042         fprintf( stderr, "Failed to malloc memory");
00043         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00044     }
00045 
00046     for ( i = 0; i < board_size; i++ ) {
00047         board[i] = malloc( board_size * sizeof(int) );
00048         hoshi[i] = malloc( board_size * sizeof(bool) );
00049         if ( board[i] == NULL || hoshi[i] == NULL ) {
00050             fprintf( stderr, "Failed to malloc memory");
00051             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00052         }
00053 
00054         for ( j = 0; j < board_size; j++ ) {
00055             board[i][j] = EMPTY;
00056             hoshi[i][j] = false;
00057         }
00058     }
00059 
00060     switch (board_size) {
00061         case 19:
00062             hoshi[3][3]   = true;
00063             hoshi[3][9]   = true;
00064             hoshi[3][15]  = true;
00065             hoshi[9][3]   = true;
00066             hoshi[9][9]   = true;
00067             hoshi[9][15]  = true;
00068             hoshi[15][3]  = true;
00069             hoshi[15][9]  = true;
00070             hoshi[15][15] = true;
00071             break;
00072         case 13:
00073             hoshi[3][3] = true;
00074             hoshi[3][9] = true;
00075             hoshi[9][3] = true;
00076             hoshi[9][9] = true;
00077             hoshi[6][6] = true;
00078             break;
00079         case 9:
00080             hoshi[2][2] = true;
00081             hoshi[2][6] = true;
00082             hoshi[6][2] = true;
00083             hoshi[6][6] = true;
00084             hoshi[4][4] = true;
00085             break;
00086     }
00087 
00088     return;
00089 }

00091 /*******************************************************************/
00092 /*  Usage     : free_board()                                       */
00093 /*  Purpose   : Frees the memory allocated for board and hoshi     */
00094 /*  Parameter : none                                               */
00095 /*  Returns   : nothing                                            */
00096 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00097 /*  Comment   : none                                               */
00098 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00099 /*******************************************************************/
00100 void free_board(void) {
00101     int i;
00102 
00103     for ( i = 0; i < board_size; i++ ) {
00104         free(board[i]);
00105         free(hoshi[i]);
00106     }
00107     free(board);
00108     free(hoshi);
00109 
00110     return;
00111 }

00113 /*******************************************************************/
00114 /*  Usage     : get_board_as_string()                              */
00115 /*  Purpose   : Returns a printable represantation of the board    */
00116 /*  Parameter : none                                               */
00117 /*  Returns   : String of complete board                           */
00118 /*  Throws    : Nothing                                            */
00119 /*  Comment   : This should look exactly what is shown by GnuGo    */
00120 /*  See also  : [n/a]                                              */
00121 /*******************************************************************/
00122 void get_board_as_string( char board_output[] ) {
00123     int i; // Index for x-axis
00124     int j; // Index for y-axis
00125     char x[3];      // Label for x-axis
00126     char y[2];      // Label for y-axis
00127 
00128     board_output[0] = '\0';
00129     strcat( board_output, "\n" );
00130 
00131     /* Print uppercase letters above the board */
00132     strcat( board_output, "   " );
00133     for ( i = 0; i < board_size; i++ ) {
00134         get_label_x( i, x );
00135         strcat( board_output, " " );
00136         strcat( board_output, x );
00137     }
00138     strcat( board_output, "\n" );
00139 
00140     for ( j = board_size - 1; j >= 0; j-- ) {
00141 
00142         /* Print numbers left of board */
00143         get_label_y_left( j, y );
00144         strcat( board_output, " " );
00145         strcat( board_output, y );
00146 
00147         /* Print board fields */
00148         for ( i = 0; i < board_size; i++ ) {
00149             strcat( board_output, " " );
00150             switch ( board[i][j] ) {
00151                 case WHITE:
00152                     strcat( board_output, WHITE_STONE );
00153                     break;
00154                 case BLACK:
00155                     strcat( board_output, BLACK_STONE );
00156                     break;
00157                 case EMPTY:
00158                     switch ( is_hoshi( i, j ) ) {
00159                         case true:
00160                             strcat( board_output, FIELD_HOSHI );
00161                             break;
00162                         case false:
00163                             strcat( board_output, FIELD_EMPTY );
00164                             break;
00165                     }
00166                     break;
00167             }
00168         }
00169 
00170         /* Print numbers right of board */
00171         get_label_y_right( j, y );
00172         strcat( board_output,  " " );
00173         strcat( board_output,    y );
00174         strcat( board_output, "\n" );
00175     }
00176 
00177     /* Print uppercase letters below board */
00178     strcat( board_output, "   " );
00179     for ( i = 0; i < board_size; i++ ) {
00180         get_label_x( i, x );
00181         strcat( board_output, " " );
00182         strcat( board_output, x );
00183     }
00184 
00185     return;
00186 }

00188 void get_label_x( int i, char x[] ) {
00189 
00190     if ( i >= 8 ) {
00191         i++;
00192     }
00193     i += 65;
00194     x[0] = (char) i;
00195     x[1] = '\0';
00196 
00197     return;
00198 }
00199 
00200 void get_label_y_left( int j, char y[] ) {
00201 
00202     j++;
00203 
00204     y[0] = (char)(int)( j / 10 + 48 );
00205     y[1] = (char)( j % 10 + 48 );
00206     y[2] = '\0';
00207     if ( y[0] == '0' ) {
00208         y[0] = ' ';
00209     }
00210 
00211     return;
00212 }
00213 
00214 void get_label_y_right( int j, char y[] ) {
00215 
00216     j++;
00217 
00218     y[0] = (char)(int)( j / 10 + 48 );
00219     y[1] = (char)( j % 10 + 48 );
00220     y[2] = '\0';
00221     if ( y[0] == '0' ) {
00222         y[0] = y[1];
00223         y[1] = '\0';
00224     }
00225 
00226     return;
00227 }

00229 bool is_hoshi( int i, int j ) {
00230 
00231     return hoshi[i][j];
00232 }
